title: CLAUDE.md
text:
This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.


This is a Quarto website project for vincentgaul.github.io - a personal website for Vincent Gaul, a biochemist in the pharmaceutical industry who works as a data scientist. The site is built using Quarto, a scientific and technical publishing system.






quarto render - Build the entire website (outputs to /docs directory)
quarto preview - Start development server with live reload (automatically reloads on file changes)
quarto preview --no-browser - Preview without opening browser
quarto preview --port 4444 - Preview on specific port





quarto render index.qmd - Render single file
quarto render about.qmd --to html - Render with specific format






_quarto.yml - Main configuration file defining website structure, theme (cosmo), and navbar
index.qmd - Homepage content file
about.qmd - About page content file

styles.css - Custom CSS styles
/docs - Output directory where rendered HTML files are generated (published to GitHub Pages)
/docs/site_libs - Generated assets (Bootstrap, Quarto JS/CSS, search functionality)




The website uses: - Theme: Cosmo Bootstrap theme - Output Directory: /docs (configured for GitHub Pages hosting) - Navigation: Simple navbar with Home and About links - Features: Table of contents enabled, custom CSS styling



Content is written in Quarto Markdown (.qmd) files with YAML frontmatter for metadata. The website automatically rebuilds when content files are modified during preview mode.

title: Projects
text:
ChromaAnalyzer is a Windows application used for Transitional Analysis (TA) of chromatography data generated in the pharmaceutical industry.
TA is a non-intrusive, in-process method for evaluating packed-column performance. Instead of resource-intensive, point-in-time measurements of resin integrity, ChromaAnalyzer can provide near real time performance metrics.
Traditionally the use of TA has required specialist expertise in signal processing and custom code or expensive subscriptions to commercial software. ChromaAnalyzer avoids both.

title: Projects
text:
ChromaAnalyzer is a Windows application used for Transitional Analysis (TA) of chromatography data generated in the pharmaceutical industry.
TA is a non-intrusive, in-process method for evaluating packed-column performance. Instead of resource-intensive, point-in-time measurements of resin integrity, ChromaAnalyzer can provide near real time performance metrics.
Traditionally the use of TA has required specialist expertise in signal processing and custom code or expensive subscriptions to commercial software. ChromaAnalyzer avoids both.

title: Vincent Gaul
text: PhD Biochemist with experience in biopharmaceutical manufacturing, data science, and software development. Expertise in cell culture, purification, and analytical methods. R first data scientist with working knowledge of python, JavaScript, and other languages.

title: Vincent Gaul
text: I am a biochemist in the pharmaceutical industry bridging the gap between life science and data science. I have a PhD in biochemistry and have previously worked in technical services roles providing support to commercial scale manufacturing in both sustaining and tech transfer environments. I now work as a data scientist where I seek to leverage manufacturing data to drive insights and improvements.

title: Vincent Gaul
text:
Welcome
Welcome to my website where I will share insights about the intersection of biochemistry, data science, and pharmaceutical manufacturing.
